title: Shelburne 2015 Crimson Sails Dry Marquette (Vermont)
description: Wild-berry aromas are muted and a shade green on the nose. Cassis, wild raspberry and tart cranberry flavors are at odds with cedar, cinnamon and oak influences. Lacking focus, crushed velvet tannins attempt to pull everything together, riding into a tangy finish.

title: Shelburne 2015 Untamed Marquette (Vermont)
description: Violet, blueberry and cedar aromas ride over a rubbery tone. Mild acidity struggles to keep jammy pomegranate and cranberry flavors in check, while structured tannins and white-pepper flavors tingle on the tongue.

title: Tenute Chiaromonte 2015 Primitivo (Puglia)
description: Easygoing, primary aromas of strawberry and raspberry jam take center stage on the nose and palate. This is light in feel and juicy in profile, ending on a dry, cranberry skin finish.

title: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Subdued aromas of underbrush, moist soil, chopped herb and a whiff of red berry appear in the glass. The simple light-bodied palate shows suggestions of sour cherry and white pepper alongside loose fleeting tannins. Drink now.

title: Cantele 2015 Teresamanara Chardonnay (Salento)
description: Lemon peel aromas take on a slightly savory cheese-rind like tone on the nose. The palate offers richness from oak, displaying toasted nut flavors over lemon and apple. The oak seems a bit disjointed, throwing the fruit tones off balance.

title: Château Saint-Christophe 2015  Médoc
description: This wine, with its high-toast character, is spicy and conveys bitter dark chocolate from extraction. Although it will soften, this wine will likely remain firm with plenty of tannic structure.

title: Château Belle Assise Coureau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 84–86. Barrel Sample. This is a dense wine, highly extracted and tough. Hulking tannins seem at odds with the fruit; this could have difficulty aging well.

title: Eleven 2016 Sugarloaf Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of soda water, peach and melon lead to broad, dry, slightly viscous fruit flavors. It's an unusual interpretation of this variety.

title: Gil Luna 2016 Sin Complejos  (Toro)
description: Rubbery dark-fruit aromas come with cheesy oak scents. This basic Toro has a sticky, saucy mouthfeel bolstered by tartaric acidity. Short, oaky berry flavors are chocolaty, while the finish offers mostly residual oak notes.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2016 Gilgal Pinot Noir (Galilee)
description: Medium cherry in color, this wine offers aromas of blackberry, cassis and smoked meat. Flavors of black cherry, flint and game never quite coalesce, dropping off into a soft sage-tinged finish.

title: Gray Ghost 2016 Seyval Blanc (Virginia)
description: This wine offers candied citrus aromas and flavors, with a chalky fruitiness reminiscent of crushed vitamins on the palate. It has mild acidity but is a little flimsy in feel. The finish is long and sour.

title: Lo Sparviere 2009 Dosaggio Zero Riserva  (Franciacorta)
description: Toast, oak and nut aromas carry over to the lean palate along with adhesive bandage sensations. Vigorous bubbles provide the firm backdrop while an extremely bitter walnut note marks the finish.

title: Palma Real 2016 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: Citrusy aromas show mild pyrazine notes. This has an oily but citrusy mouthfeel along with flavors of orange peel and pulp as well as scallion. A lingering citric finish is moderately zesty.

title: Rocca di Frassinello 2015 Poggio alla Guardia  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This opens with earthy aromas of black-skinned fruit, tilled soil and a hint of crushed black olive. The aromas carry over to the extremely simple palate alongside round tannins.

title: Schmidt 2016 Viognier (Applegate Valley)
description: Viognier above 16% alcohol is really pushing the boundaries of ripeness, and it results in a rather flat-tasting wine with one-dimensional fruit flavors and nothing else. Peaches and melon, with a hint of citrus rind come through, but how do you match this to food?

title: Ten Spoon Vineyard + Winery 2016 Sweet Talk Riesling (America)
description: Made in Montana with grapes from Yakima Valley, this wine shows aromas of tangerine, white peach and honeysuckle. The palate is juicy in ripe lime, fresh apricot and blossom tones, with enough acidity for balance. The finish is brief and peachy.

title: Contadi Castaldi 2011 Soul Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of dried apricot and walnut carry over to the straightforward sparkling palate along with acacia honey. It's racy and assertive, with vivacious, rather steely bubbles.

title: Cória 2014 Don Simón Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Apparently a reserve-level offering, this has the same overripe raisined character as the regular 2015 Pinot. The fruit may have been harvested late, or in a rain window—whatever the cause, this is well past optimal ripeness, drying out, and should be consumed in the near term.

title: Cruz de Piedra 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Foxy berry aromas are fruity and jumpy. This wine is grapy on the palate, and more flat than lively. Jammy black-fruit flavors are herbal, while mint and peppery notes drive the finish.

title: Castello Monaci 2016 Acante Fiano (Salento)
description: Reticent on the nose in aromas of struck flint, citrus and pollen, these notes carry to a astringent palate of apple and citrus. Medium in weight, there's just enough mouthwatering acidity to maintain freshness.

title: Cantina Le Grotte 2015 Selva Della Rocca Nero di Troia (Puglia)
description: Spiced fruit cake aromas dominate the nose and carry to the medium-bodied, approachable palate. This is simple and straightforward with everything in balance—perfect for everyday enjoyment.

title: Cantine del Borgo Reale 2016 Pinot Grigio (Puglia)
description: An atypical variety for such a southern region, this Pinot Grigio shows some semblance to its brethren in the north, with apple, citrus and blossom tones, yet its missing all of the vibrancy and verve from a lack of acidity. Nevertheless, it's a perfectly clean and simple drink.

title: Casar de Burbia 2014 Casar Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A dark color and damp aromas of raisin lack freshness. Overall, this wine is stewed and oaky, with a heavy palate that's showing salty oak-driven berry and prune flavors. It's missing in balance and finishes with persistent saltiness.

title: Château le Monge 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Toasty and woody, this wine is currently dominated by the wood aging, leaving little space for the juicy red fruits in the background. It will soften and should be less aggressive from 2019.

title: Clos de Nit 2014 Crianza Red (Montsant)
description: Stalky aromas of earthy plum and burnt leaves are not fully ripe. A choppy, gritty palate holds saucy flavors of salted plum, tomato and herbs. A short finish with herbal notes is appropriate. The blend holds Garnacha, Carignan and Syrah.

title: Cória 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Scents of wet hay and overripe raisined fruit don't mislead: those are also the flavors. Some tarragon and citrus is in view, but overall it's disjointed and seems already well on the way to being over the hill.

title: Dablon 2016 Sweet Riesling (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Mild aromas of green apple and lemon have a grassy undercurrent, yet the palate is surprisingly lush in flavors of canned peach and mandarin. The finish is rubbery, with notes of lime pith and orange-blossom honey.

title: Airlie 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Barrel fermented for 10 months, this wine, now three years past its vintage, remains awkward and oaky. Flavors of wood and butter dominate, with light generic fruit well in the background.

title: Anarkos 2015 Rosso Red (Puglia)
description: Ultraripe cherry and blackberry aromas are covered in a sheen of dark chocolate on the nose of this Negroamaro, Primitivo and Malvasia Nero blend. The medium-bodied palate turns more jammy in baked strawberry and cherry flavors, with grainy tannins and just enough acidity for balance.

title: Aragus 2016 Blanco Viura (Campo de Borja)
description: A largely neutral nose hints at papaya and melon. This Viura is lean in feel, with lemony acidity. Generic nectarine and melon flavors flatten out on a finish that's showing early-onset oxidation. Drink right away for best results.
